paper_abstract: This paper presents an optimal fuzzy controller design method using an evolutionary strategy-based particle swarm optimization (ESPSO) to four-wheeled redundant mobile robots, called FC-ESPSO. In comparison with conventional fuzzy controllers, this approach takes the advantages of evolutionary strategy, fuzzy control, and PSO, thereby obtaining better population diversity, avoiding premature convergence, and achieving self-adaptive redundant control. This hybrid computing is then applied to develop an optimal fuzzy controller of redundant wheeled robots. The optimal parameters of the dynamic controller are self-adaptive via the proposed FC-ESPSO to resolve trajectory-tracking problem. Simulation results are given to exhibit the merits of the proposed FC-ESPSO than other related control methods for redundant wheeled robots.
paper_title: Optimal Fuzzy Controller Design Using an Evolutionary Strategy-Based Particle Swarm Optimization for Redundant Wheeled Robots
